description:
Heycoach has designed a new File system. It is possible to use any number of characters `'/'` as a delimiter in path instead of one traditional `' / '`. For **example**, strings `//usr///local//user/sbin//` and `/usr/local/user///sbin` are equivalent.

The character `'/'` (or some sequence of such characters) at the end of the path is required only in case of the path to the root directory, which can be represented as single character `'/'`.

**Note:** A path called normalized if it contains the smallest possible number of characters '`/'`.

You are given a string `s`. Your task is to transform a given path to the **normalized** form.

**Example**
```
Input : s = "//usr///local//folder///sbin"

Output : "/usr/local/folder/sbin"

```

**Input Format**
```
The first line of the input contains string s , containing only lowercase Latin letters and character ' / ' — the path to some directory. 
```
**Output Format**
```
A String, The path in normalized form.
```
**Constraints**

`2 <= s.length <= 100`

`s contains only lowercase latin letters, and symbol '/'`

`There will be atleast 1 '/' in s`
title: Normalize Path in File System

class Solution {
    public String normalizePath(String s) {
